questions.text: What damage, if any, did the first bomb that was dropped on Berlin, by the Allies during World War II, cause?
questions.correct: It killed the only elephant in Berlin Zoo
options: None, it remained unexploded until after the war
It killed Adolf Hitler's dog, Wolfgang
questions.explanation:
It killed the only elephant in Berlin Zoo.

	And it was the very first bomb too ...

questions.text: What did Al Capone's business card say he did for a living?
options: Talent scout for the Chicago Cubs
questions.explanation:
Used furniture dealer.

	Would you argue with him?

questions.text: Who was the Baby Ruth candy bar purported to be named after?
options: Ruth Randall, the daughter of Nestle's Chairman
questions.explanation:
Grover Cleveland's baby daughter, Ruth.

	Through many claims, lawsuits and refuted rumours, the "Baby Ruth" chocolate bar was supposedly named after Grover Cleveland's daughter, Ruth. However, it was launched at a time where George Herman Ruth was at a peak, and it was probably a ploy to get out of payig royalties to the legendary baseball player.

questions.text: What is the only US state whose name is just one syllable?
A dragonfly lives only 24 hours (or thereabouts - certainly no longer than a day and a half!).
questions.explanation:
False.

	A dragonfly can live as long as seven years - so the popular myth that they live only a day is silly.

questions.text: The highest point in Pennsylvania is lower than the lowest point in Colorado.
What is the average life span of a major league baseball?
What is present somewhere in every episode of Seinfeld?
What was the name of the plane Buddy Holly died in?
questions.explanation:
N3794N.

	There is an urban legend that the plane was called "The American Pie", hence the name of Don MacLean's song, but really, it only had a serial number.
